text: Is it possible to build and browse the V1 documentation in my dev environment?

Luis - are you after the actual doc output (read the docs; essentially what you see here - <http://hyperledger-fabric.readthedocs.io/en/latest/>)?  Or are you looking for SDK docs?  There is a way to compile locally and see the output if you're pushing doc updates.  <@U11HH3P7Y>  and I can help show you how

attachments.title: Hyperledger Fabric
attachments.text: Welcome to the Hyperledger fabric documentation

text: What are we calling January 31 - is that an IBM delivery, or an LF delivery.
<@U10LM0FFZ>, I’m looking to compile locally and see the output.
yea that's what I figured.  basically you just push to your fork of the fabric repo on github and then add hooks to build RTD every time you push.
So, RTD/latest is what is currently in master?

yes sir.  It builds against the doc directory anytime there is a new merge.  I will show you how to add the hooks.  Frankly I need a refresher course too.  Yes, you use github to preview the output, and then you can do a real push to gerrit if you like the formatting
Ok. Great… I’ll reach out to you again once I have some content to deliver.
